Leaky ReLU¶

class layers.activation.LeakyReLU.LeakyReLU(alpha=0.01)[source]¶

Implements the Leaky ReLU (Leaky Rectified Linear Unit) activation layer.

The Leaky ReLU is a variation of the ReLU function. For positive inputs, it behaves like a standard ReLU (f(x) = x), but for negative inputs, it has a small, non-zero, constant slope (f(x) = alpha * x). This helps to prevent the “Dying ReLU” problem.

input¶

Stores the input from the forward pass, which is needed to calculate the gradient in the backward pass.

Type:

np.ndarray

alpha¶

The slope for negative input values.

Type:

float

backward(grad_output)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the layer.

It computes the derivative of the Leaky ReLU function and applies it to the incoming gradient from the next layer (using the chain rule).

Parameters:

grad_output (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s output.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s input.

  • None, since LeakyReLU has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data from the previous layer.

Returns:

The output of the layer after applying ReLU.

Return type:

np.ndarray
